intro: Barrotia altissima, commonly known as the tall barrotia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
